annotations.description:
This is an alert that is used to inhibit info alerts.
By themselves, the info-level alerts are sometimes very noisy, but they are relevant when combined with
other alerts.
This alert fires whenever there's a severity="info" alert, and stops firing when another alert with a
severity of 'warning' or 'critical' starts firing on the same namespace.
This alert should be routed to a null receiver and configured to inhibit alerts with severity="info".
annotations.summary: Info-level alert inhibition.

annotations.description: {{ printf "%.4g" $value }}% of the {{ $labels.job }}/{{ $labels.service }} targets in {{ $labels.namespace }} namespace are down.

annotations.description:
This is an alert meant to ensure that the entire alerting pipeline is functional.
This alert is always firing, therefore it should always be firing in Alertmanager
and always fire against a receiver. There are integrations with various notification
mechanisms that send a notification when this alert is not firing. For example the
"DeadMansSnitch" integration in PagerDuty.
annotations.summary: An alert that should always be firing to certify that Alertmanager is working properly.

rules.name: node_namespace_pod_container:container_memory_swap

rules.name: namespace_cpu:kube_pod_container_resource_limits:sum
rules.query: sum by (namespace, cluster) (sum by (namespace, pod, cluster) (max by (namespace, pod, container, cluster) (kube_pod_container_resource_limits{job="kube-state-metrics",resource="cpu"}) * on (namespace, pod, cluster) group_left () max by (namespace, pod, cluster) (kube_pod_status_phase{phase=~"Pending|Running"} == 1)))

rules.name: namespace_cpu:kube_pod_container_resource_requests:sum
rules.query: sum by (namespace, cluster) (sum by (namespace, pod, cluster) (max by (namespace, pod, container, cluster) (kube_pod_container_resource_requests{job="kube-state-metrics",resource="cpu"}) * on (namespace, pod, cluster) group_left () max by (namespace, pod, cluster) (kube_pod_status_phase{phase=~"Pending|Running"} == 1)))

rules.name: namespace_workload_pod:kube_pod_owner:relabel

rules.name: apiserver_request:availability30d

rules.name: instance:node_cpu:ratio
rules.query: sum without (cpu, mode) (rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode!="idle",mode!="iowait",mode!="steal"}[5m])) / on (instance) group_left () count by (instance) (sum by (instance, cpu) (node_cpu_seconds_total))

annotations.description: kube-state-metrics is experiencing errors at an elevated rate in list operations. This is likely causing it to not be able to expose metrics about Kubernetes objects correctly or at all.
annotations.summary: kube-state-metrics is experiencing errors in list operations.

annotations.description: kube-state-metrics pods are running with different --total-shards configuration, some Kubernetes objects may be exposed multiple times or not exposed at all.
annotations.summary: kube-state-metrics sharding is misconfigured.

annotations.description: kube-state-metrics shards are missing, some Kubernetes objects are not being exposed.
annotations.summary: kube-state-metrics shards are missing.

rules.name: KubeStateMetricsShardsMissing
rules.query: 2 ^ max by (cluster) (kube_state_metrics_total_shards{job="kube-state-metrics"}) - 1 - sum by (cluster) (2 ^ max by (cluster, shard_ordinal) (kube_state_metrics_shard_ordinal{job="kube-state-metrics"})) != 0

annotations.description: kube-state-metrics is experiencing errors at an elevated rate in watch operations. This is likely causing it to not be able to expose metrics about Kubernetes objects correctly or at all.
annotations.summary: kube-state-metrics is experiencing errors in watch operations.

rules.name: node_quantile:kubelet_pleg_relist_duration_seconds:histogram_quantile
rules.query: histogram_quantile(0.5, sum by (cluster, instance, le) (rate(kubelet_pleg_relist_duration_seconds_bucket{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics"}[5m])) * on (cluster, instance) group_left (node) kubelet_node_name{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics"})

rules.name: node_quantile:kubelet_pleg_relist_duration_seconds:histogram_quantile
rules.query: histogram_quantile(0.9, sum by (cluster, instance, le) (rate(kubelet_pleg_relist_duration_seconds_bucket{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics"}[5m])) * on (cluster, instance) group_left (node) kubelet_node_name{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics"})

rules.name: node_quantile:kubelet_pleg_relist_duration_seconds:histogram_quantile
rules.query: histogram_quantile(0.99, sum by (cluster, instance, le) (rate(kubelet_pleg_relist_duration_seconds_bucket{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics"}[5m])) * on (cluster, instance) group_left (node) kubelet_node_name{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics"})

annotations.description: pod/{{ $labels.pod }} in namespace {{ $labels.namespace }} on container {{ $labels.container}} has been in waiting state for longer than 1 hour.
annotations.summary: Pod container waiting longer than 1 hour

annotations.description: {{ $value }} Pods of DaemonSet {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.daemonset }} are running where they are not supposed to run.
annotations.summary: DaemonSet pods are misscheduled.

annotations.description: {{ $value }} Pods of DaemonSet {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.daemonset }} are not scheduled.
annotations.summary: DaemonSet pods are not scheduled.

annotations.description: DaemonSet {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.daemonset }} has not finished or progressed for at least 15 minutes.
annotations.summary: DaemonSet rollout is stuck.

annotations.description: Deployment generation for {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.deployment }} does not match, this indicates that the Deployment has failed but has not been rolled back.
annotations.summary: Deployment generation mismatch due to possible roll-back

annotations.description: Deployment {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.deployment }} has not matched the expected number of replicas for longer than 15 minutes.
annotations.summary: Deployment has not matched the expected number of replicas.

annotations.description: Rollout of deployment {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.deployment }} is not progressing for longer than 15 minutes.
annotations.summary: Deployment rollout is not progressing.

annotations.description: HPA {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.horizontalpodautoscaler  }} has been running at max replicas for longer than 15 minutes.
annotations.summary: HPA is running at max replicas

annotations.description: HPA {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.horizontalpodautoscaler  }} has not matched the desired number of replicas for longer than 15 minutes.
annotations.summary: HPA has not matched desired number of replicas.

annotations.description: Job {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.job_name }} failed to complete. Removing failed job after investigation should clear this alert.
annotations.summary: Job failed to complete.

annotations.description: Pod {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.pod }} ({{ $labels.container }}) is in waiting state (reason: "CrashLoopBackOff").
annotations.summary: Pod is crash looping.

annotations.description: Pod {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.pod }} has been in a non-ready state for longer than 15 minutes.
annotations.summary: Pod has been in a non-ready state for more than 15 minutes.

rules.name: KubePodNotReady
rules.query: sum by (namespace, pod, cluster) (max by (namespace, pod, cluster) (kube_pod_status_phase{job="kube-state-metrics",namespace=~".*",phase=~"Pending|Unknown|Failed"}) * on (namespace, pod, cluster) group_left (owner_kind) topk by (namespace, pod, cluster) (1, max by (namespace, pod, owner_kind, cluster) (kube_pod_owner{owner_kind!="Job"}))) > 0

annotations.description: StatefulSet generation for {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.statefulset }} does not match, this indicates that the StatefulSet has failed but has not been rolled back.
annotations.summary: StatefulSet generation mismatch due to possible roll-back

annotations.description: StatefulSet {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.statefulset }} has not matched the expected number of replicas for longer than 15 minutes.
annotations.summary: StatefulSet has not matched the expected number of replicas.

annotations.description: StatefulSet {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.statefulset }} update has not been rolled out.
annotations.summary: StatefulSet update has not been rolled out.

annotations.description: {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} throttling of CPU in namespace {{ $labels.namespace }} for container {{ $labels.container }} in pod {{ $labels.pod }}.
annotations.summary: Processes experience elevated CPU throttling.

rules.name: CPUThrottlingHigh
rules.query: sum by (cluster, container, pod, namespace) (increase(container_cpu_cfs_throttled_periods_total{container!=""}[5m])) / sum by (cluster, container, pod, namespace) (increase(container_cpu_cfs_periods_total[5m])) > (25 / 100)

annotations.description: Cluster {{ $labels.cluster }} has overcommitted CPU resource requests for Pods by {{ $value }} CPU shares and cannot tolerate node failure.
annotations.summary: Cluster has overcommitted CPU resource requests.

rules.name: KubeCPUOvercommit
rules.query: sum by (cluster) (namespace_cpu:kube_pod_container_resource_requests:sum{job="kube-state-metrics"}) - (sum by (cluster) (kube_node_status_allocatable{job="kube-state-metrics",resource="cpu"}) - max by (cluster) (kube_node_status_allocatable{job="kube-state-metrics",resource="cpu"})) > 0 and (sum by (cluster) (kube_node_status_allocatable{job="kube-state-metrics",resource="cpu"}) - max by (cluster) (kube_node_status_allocatable{job="kube-state-metrics",resource="cpu"})) > 0

annotations.description: Cluster {{ $labels.cluster }}  has overcommitted CPU resource requests for Namespaces.
annotations.summary: Cluster has overcommitted CPU resource requests.

annotations.description: Cluster {{ $labels.cluster }} has overcommitted memory resource requests for Pods by {{ $value | humanize }} bytes and cannot tolerate node failure.
annotations.summary: Cluster has overcommitted memory resource requests.

rules.name: KubeMemoryOvercommit
rules.query: sum by (cluster) (namespace_memory:kube_pod_container_resource_requests:sum) - (sum by (cluster) (kube_node_status_allocatable{job="kube-state-metrics",resource="memory"}) - max by (cluster) (kube_node_status_allocatable{job="kube-state-metrics",resource="memory"})) > 0 and (sum by (cluster) (kube_node_status_allocatable{job="kube-state-metrics",resource="memory"}) - max by (cluster) (kube_node_status_allocatable{job="kube-state-metrics",resource="memory"})) > 0

annotations.description: Cluster {{ $labels.cluster }}  has overcommitted memory resource requests for Namespaces.
annotations.summary: Cluster has overcommitted memory resource requests.

annotations.description: Namespace {{ $labels.namespace }} is using {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} of its {{ $labels.resource }} quota.
annotations.summary: Namespace quota is going to be full.

annotations.description: Namespace {{ $labels.namespace }} is using {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} of its {{ $labels.resource }} quota.
annotations.summary: Namespace quota has exceeded the limits.

annotations.description: Namespace {{ $labels.namespace }} is using {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} of its {{ $labels.resource }} quota.
annotations.summary: Namespace quota is fully used.

annotations.description: The persistent volume {{ $labels.persistentvolume }} on Cluster {{ $labels.cluster }} has status {{ $labels.phase }}.
annotations.summary: PersistentVolume is having issues with provisioning.

annotations.description: The PersistentVolume claimed by {{ $labels.persistentvolumeclaim }} in Namespace {{ $labels.namespace }} on Cluster {{ $labels.cluster }} is only {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} free.
annotations.summary: PersistentVolume is filling up.

rules.name: KubePersistentVolumeFillingUp
rules.query: (kubelet_volume_stats_available_bytes{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics",namespace=~".*"} / kubelet_volume_stats_capacity_bytes{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics",namespace=~".*"}) < 0.03 and kubelet_volume_stats_used_bytes{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics",namespace=~".*"} > 0 unless on (cluster, namespace, persistentvolumeclaim) kube_persistentvolumeclaim_access_mode{access_mode="ReadOnlyMany"} == 1 unless on (cluster, namespace, persistentvolumeclaim) kube_persistentvolumeclaim_labels{label_excluded_from_alerts="true"} == 1

annotations.description: Based on recent sampling, the PersistentVolume claimed by {{ $labels.persistentvolumeclaim }} in Namespace {{ $labels.namespace }} on Cluster {{ $labels.cluster }} is expected to fill up within four days. Currently {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} is available.
annotations.summary: PersistentVolume is filling up.

rules.name: KubePersistentVolumeFillingUp
rules.query: (kubelet_volume_stats_available_bytes{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics",namespace=~".*"} / kubelet_volume_stats_capacity_bytes{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics",namespace=~".*"}) < 0.15 and kubelet_volume_stats_used_bytes{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics",namespace=~".*"} > 0 and predict_linear(kubelet_volume_stats_available_bytes{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics",namespace=~".*"}[6h], 4 * 24 * 3600) < 0 unless on (cluster, namespace, persistentvolumeclaim) kube_persistentvolumeclaim_access_mode{access_mode="ReadOnlyMany"} == 1 unless on (cluster, namespace, persistentvolumeclaim) kube_persistentvolumeclaim_labels{label_excluded_from_alerts="true"} == 1

annotations.description: The PersistentVolume claimed by {{ $labels.persistentvolumeclaim }} in Namespace {{ $labels.namespace }} on Cluster {{ $labels.cluster }} only has {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} free inodes.
annotations.summary: PersistentVolumeInodes are filling up.

rules.name: KubePersistentVolumeInodesFillingUp
rules.query: (kubelet_volume_stats_inodes_free{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics",namespace=~".*"} / kubelet_volume_stats_inodes{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics",namespace=~".*"}) < 0.03 and kubelet_volume_stats_inodes_used{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics",namespace=~".*"} > 0 unless on (cluster, namespace, persistentvolumeclaim) kube_persistentvolumeclaim_access_mode{access_mode="ReadOnlyMany"} == 1 unless on (cluster, namespace, persistentvolumeclaim) kube_persistentvolumeclaim_labels{label_excluded_from_alerts="true"} == 1

annotations.description: Based on recent sampling, the PersistentVolume claimed by {{ $labels.persistentvolumeclaim }} in Namespace {{ $labels.namespace }} on Cluster {{ $labels.cluster }} is expected to run out of inodes within four days. Currently {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} of its inodes are free.
annotations.summary: PersistentVolumeInodes are filling up.

rules.name: KubePersistentVolumeInodesFillingUp
rules.query: (kubelet_volume_stats_inodes_free{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics",namespace=~".*"} / kubelet_volume_stats_inodes{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics",namespace=~".*"}) < 0.15 and kubelet_volume_stats_inodes_used{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics",namespace=~".*"} > 0 and predict_linear(kubelet_volume_stats_inodes_free{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics",namespace=~".*"}[6h], 4 * 24 * 3600) < 0 unless on (cluster, namespace, persistentvolumeclaim) kube_persistentvolumeclaim_access_mode{access_mode="ReadOnlyMany"} == 1 unless on (cluster, namespace, persistentvolumeclaim) kube_persistentvolumeclaim_labels{label_excluded_from_alerts="true"} == 1

annotations.description: KubeAPI has disappeared from Prometheus target discovery.
annotations.summary: Target disappeared from Prometheus target discovery.

annotations.description: The kubernetes apiserver has terminated {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} of its incoming requests.
annotations.summary: The kubernetes apiserver has terminated {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} of its incoming requests.

annotations.description: Kubernetes aggregated API {{ $labels.name }}/{{ $labels.namespace }} has been only {{ $value | humanize }}% available over the last 10m.
annotations.summary: Kubernetes aggregated API is down.

annotations.description: Kubernetes aggregated API {{ $labels.name }}/{{ $labels.namespace }} has reported errors. It has appeared unavailable {{ $value | humanize }} times averaged over the past 10m.
annotations.summary: Kubernetes aggregated API has reported errors.

annotations.description: A client certificate used to authenticate to kubernetes apiserver is expiring in less than 24.0 hours.
annotations.summary: Client certificate is about to expire.

rules.name: KubeClientCertificateExpiration
rules.query: apiserver_client_certificate_expiration_seconds_count{job="apiserver"} > 0 and on (job) histogram_quantile(0.01, sum by (job, le) (rate(apiserver_client_certificate_expiration_seconds_bucket{job="apiserver"}[5m]))) < 86400

annotations.description: A client certificate used to authenticate to kubernetes apiserver is expiring in less than 7.0 days.
annotations.summary: Client certificate is about to expire.

rules.name: KubeClientCertificateExpiration
rules.query: apiserver_client_certificate_expiration_seconds_count{job="apiserver"} > 0 and on (job) histogram_quantile(0.01, sum by (job, le) (rate(apiserver_client_certificate_expiration_seconds_bucket{job="apiserver"}[5m]))) < 604800

annotations.description: KubeControllerManager has disappeared from Prometheus target discovery.
annotations.summary: Target disappeared from Prometheus target discovery.

annotations.description: Kubernetes API server client '{{ $labels.job }}/{{ $labels.instance }}' is experiencing {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} errors.'
annotations.summary: Kubernetes API server client is experiencing errors.

rules.name: KubeClientErrors
rules.query: (sum by (cluster, instance, job, namespace) (rate(rest_client_requests_total{code=~"5..",job="apiserver"}[5m])) / sum by (cluster, instance, job, namespace) (rate(rest_client_requests_total{job="apiserver"}[5m]))) > 0.01

annotations.description: There are {{ $value }} different semantic versions of Kubernetes components running.
annotations.summary: Different semantic versions of Kubernetes components running.

annotations.description: KubeProxy has disappeared from Prometheus target discovery.
annotations.summary: Target disappeared from Prometheus target discovery.

annotations.description: {{ $labels.node }} has been unready for more than 15 minutes.
annotations.summary: Node is not ready.

annotations.description: The readiness status of node {{ $labels.node }} has changed {{ $value }} times in the last 15 minutes.
annotations.summary: Node readiness status is flapping.

annotations.description: {{ $labels.node }} is unreachable and some workloads may be rescheduled.
annotations.summary: Node is unreachable.

annotations.description: Client certificate for Kubelet on node {{ $labels.node }} expires in {{ $value | humanizeDuration }}.
annotations.summary: Kubelet client certificate is about to expire.

annotations.description: Client certificate for Kubelet on node {{ $labels.node }} expires in {{ $value | humanizeDuration }}.
annotations.summary: Kubelet client certificate is about to expire.

annotations.description: Kubelet on node {{ $labels.node }} has failed to renew its client certificate ({{ $value | humanize }} errors in the last 5 minutes).
annotations.summary: Kubelet has failed to renew its client certificate.

annotations.description: Kubelet has disappeared from Prometheus target discovery.
annotations.summary: Target disappeared from Prometheus target discovery.

annotations.description: The Kubelet Pod Lifecycle Event Generator has a 99th percentile duration of {{ $value }} seconds on node {{ $labels.node }}.
annotations.summary: Kubelet Pod Lifecycle Event Generator is taking too long to relist.

annotations.description: Kubelet Pod startup 99th percentile latency is {{ $value }} seconds on node {{ $labels.node }}.
annotations.summary: Kubelet Pod startup latency is too high.

rules.name: KubeletPodStartUpLatencyHigh
rules.query: histogram_quantile(0.99, sum by (cluster, instance, le) (rate(kubelet_pod_worker_duration_seconds_bucket{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics"}[5m]))) * on (cluster, instance) group_left (node) kubelet_node_name{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics"} > 60

annotations.description: Server certificate for Kubelet on node {{ $labels.node }} expires in {{ $value | humanizeDuration }}.
annotations.summary: Kubelet server certificate is about to expire.

annotations.description: Server certificate for Kubelet on node {{ $labels.node }} expires in {{ $value | humanizeDuration }}.
annotations.summary: Kubelet server certificate is about to expire.

annotations.description: Kubelet on node {{ $labels.node }} has failed to renew its server certificate ({{ $value | humanize }} errors in the last 5 minutes).
annotations.summary: Kubelet has failed to renew its server certificate.

annotations.description: Kubelet '{{ $labels.node }}' is running at {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} of its Pod capacity.
annotations.summary: Kubelet is running at capacity.

rules.name: KubeletTooManyPods
rules.query: count by (cluster, node) ((kube_pod_status_phase{job="kube-state-metrics",phase="Running"} == 1) * on (instance, pod, namespace, cluster) group_left (node) topk by (instance, pod, namespace, cluster) (1, kube_pod_info{job="kube-state-metrics"})) / max by (cluster, node) (kube_node_status_capacity{job="kube-state-metrics",resource="pods"} != 1) > 0.95

annotations.description: KubeScheduler has disappeared from Prometheus target discovery.
annotations.summary: Target disappeared from Prometheus target discovery.

annotations.description: Bonding interface {{ $labels.master }} on {{ $labels.instance }} is in degraded state due to one or more slave failures.
annotations.summary: Bonding interface is degraded

annotations.description: CPU usage at {{ $labels.instance }} has been above 90% for the last 15 minutes, is currently at {{ printf "%.2f" $value }}%.
annotations.summary: High CPU usage.

annotations.description:
Disk IO queue (aqu-sq) is high on {{ $labels.device }} at {{ $labels.instance }}, has been above 10 for the last 15 minutes, is currently at {{ printf "%.2f" $value }}.
This symptom might indicate disk saturation.
annotations.summary: Disk IO queue is high.

annotations.description: Memory is filling up at {{ $labels.instance }}, has been above 90% for the last 15 minutes, is currently at {{ printf "%.2f" $value }}%.
annotations.summary: Host is running out of memory.

annotations.description:
Memory major pages are occurring at very high rate at {{ $labels.instance }}, 500 major page faults per second for the last 15 minutes, is currently at {{ printf "%.2f" $value }}.
Please check that there is enough memory available at this instance.
annotations.summary: Memory major page faults are occurring at very high rate.

annotations.description:
System load per core at {{ $labels.instance }} has been above 2 for the last 15 minutes, is currently at {{ printf "%.2f" $value }}.
This might indicate this instance resources saturation and can cause it becoming unresponsive.
annotations.summary: System saturated, load per core is very high.

annotations.description: Systemd service {{ $labels.name }} has entered failed state at {{ $labels.instance }}
annotations.summary: Systemd service has entered failed state.

annotations.description: Network interface "{{ $labels.device }}" changing its up status often on node-exporter {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.pod }}
annotations.summary: Network interface is often changing its status

rules.name: node:node_num_cpu:sum
rules.query: count by (cluster, node) (node_cpu_seconds_total{job="node-exporter",mode="idle"} * on (cluster, namespace, pod) group_left (node) topk by (cluster, namespace, pod) (1, node_namespace_pod:kube_pod_info:))

rules.name: node_namespace_pod:kube_pod_info:
rules.query: topk by (cluster, namespace, pod) (1, max by (cluster, node, namespace, pod) (label_replace(kube_pod_info{job="kube-state-metrics",node!=""}, "pod", "$1", "pod", "(.*)")))

annotations.summary: Errors while performing list operations in controller.

rules.name: PrometheusOperatorListErrors
rules.query: (sum by (cluster, controller, namespace) (rate(prometheus_operator_list_operations_failed_total{job="prometheus-operator-operator",namespace="metalk8s-monitoring"}[10m])) / sum by (cluster, controller, namespace) (rate(prometheus_operator_list_operations_total{job="prometheus-operator-operator",namespace="metalk8s-monitoring"}[10m]))) > 0.4

annotations.description: Errors while reconciling Prometheus in {{ $labels.namespace }} Namespace.
annotations.summary: Errors while reconciling Prometheus.

annotations.description: Prometheus operator in {{ $labels.namespace }} namespace isn't ready to reconcile {{ $labels.controller }} resources.
annotations.summary: Prometheus operator not ready

annotations.description: {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} of reconciling operations failed for {{ $labels.controller }} controller in {{ $labels.namespace }} namespace.
annotations.summary: Errors while reconciling objects.

rules.name: PrometheusOperatorReconcileErrors
rules.query: (sum by (cluster, controller, namespace) (rate(prometheus_operator_reconcile_errors_total{job="prometheus-operator-operator",namespace="metalk8s-monitoring"}[5m]))) / (sum by (cluster, controller, namespace) (rate(prometheus_operator_reconcile_operations_total{job="prometheus-operator-operator",namespace="metalk8s-monitoring"}[5m]))) > 0.1

annotations.description: Prometheus operator in {{ $labels.namespace }} namespace rejected {{ printf "%0.0f" $value }} {{ $labels.controller }}/{{ $labels.resource }} resources.
annotations.summary: Resources rejected by Prometheus operator

annotations.description: {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} of status update operations failed for {{ $labels.controller }} controller in {{ $labels.namespace }} namespace.
annotations.summary: Errors while updating objects status.

rules.name: PrometheusOperatorStatusUpdateErrors
rules.query: (sum by (cluster, controller, namespace) (rate(prometheus_operator_status_update_errors_total{job="prometheus-operator-operator",namespace="metalk8s-monitoring"}[5m]))) / (sum by (cluster, controller, namespace) (rate(prometheus_operator_status_update_operations_total{job="prometheus-operator-operator",namespace="metalk8s-monitoring"}[5m]))) > 0.1

annotations.description: Controller {{ $labels.controller }} in {{ $labels.namespace }} namespace fails to reconcile {{ $value }} objects.

rules.name: PrometheusOperatorWatchErrors
rules.query: (sum by (cluster, controller, namespace) (rate(prometheus_operator_watch_operations_failed_total{job="prometheus-operator-operator",namespace="metalk8s-monitoring"}[5m])) / sum by (cluster, controller, namespace) (rate(prometheus_operator_watch_operations_total{job="prometheus-operator-operator",namespace="metalk8s-monitoring"}[5m]))) > 0.4
